body_content.explanation: a written or spoken statement in which you say or write that something is true all of the time when it is only true some of the time, or the use of such statements:
examples: It is an overgeneralisation to say that he never helps in the house.
Perceptions of the religion have suffered from overgeneralization.

body_content.explanation: a way of thinking in which someone expects something negative to happen in all situations because of a previous negative experience :
examples: There may be overgeneralisation of a fear to situations that resemble the original traumatic situation.

body_content.explanation: the use of a rule of language in situations where it does not need to be used, or the incorrect use of a word to refer to a similar, but different, thing :
examples: Overgeneralization is what makes a learner produce the ungrammatical form "goed" instead of the correct form "went".
In the early stages of word learning, overgeneralisation often occurs, when a child uses the wrong word to name an object.
